verses.text: Now the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto Jonah the son of Amittai , saying ,\f + \fr 1.1 \ft Jonah: Gr. Jonas\f*
Arise , go to Nineveh , that great city , and cry against it; for their wickedness is come up before me.

But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and went down to Joppa ; and he found a ship going to Tarshish : so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them unto Tarshish from the presence of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p

¶ But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent out a great wind into the sea , and there was a mighty tempest in the sea , so that the ship was like to be broken.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft sent out: Heb. cast forth\f*\f + \fr 1.4 \ft was like…: Heb. thought to be broken\f*

Then the mariners were afraid , and cried every man unto his god , and cast forth the wares that \add were\add* in the ship into the sea , to lighten \add it\add* of them. But Jonah was gone down into the sides of the ship ; and he lay , and was fast asleep.
So the shipmaster came to him, and said unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper ? arise , call upon thy God , if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not.
And they said every one to his fellow , Come , and let us cast lots , that we may know for whose cause this evil \add is\add* upon us. So they cast lots , and the lot fell upon Jonah.

Then said they unto him, Tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil \add is\add* upon us; What \add is\add* thine occupation ? and whence comest thou? what \add is\add* thy country ? and of what people \add art\add* thou?

And he said unto them, I \add am\add* an Hebrew ; and I fear the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of heaven , which hath made the sea and the dry \add land\add*.\f + \fr 1.9 \ft the \+nd LORD\+nd*: or, \+nd JEHOVAH\+nd*\f*

Then were the men exceedingly afraid , and said unto him, Why hast thou done this? For the men knew that he fled from the presence of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, because he had told them.\f + \fr 1.10 \ft exceedingly…: Heb. with great fear\f* \p

¶ Then said they unto him, What shall we do unto thee, that the sea may be calm unto us? for the sea wrought , and was tempestuous.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft may…: Heb. may be silent from us\f*\f + \fr 1.11 \ft wrought…: or, grew more and more tempestuous: Heb. went\f*
And he said unto them, Take me up , and cast me forth into the sea ; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest \add is\add* upon you.

Nevertheless the men rowed hard to bring \add it\add* to the land ; but they could not: for the sea wrought , and was tempestuous against them.\f + \fr 1.13 \ft rowed: Heb. digged\f*\f + \fr 1.13 \ft wrought…: or, grew more and more tempestuous: Heb. went\f*

Wherefore they cried unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , We beseech thee , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, we beseech thee, let us not perish for this man’s life , and lay not upon us innocent blood : for thou, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, hast done as it pleased thee.
So they took up Jonah , and cast him forth into the sea : and the sea ceased from her raging.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft ceased: Heb. stood\f*

Then the men feared the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* exceedingly , and offered a sacrifice unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and made vows.  +  r 1.16  t offered…: Heb. sacrifice unto the \+nd LORD\+nd*, and vowed vows * \p
¶ Now the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft belly: Heb. bowels\f*
